column1: anyone who has actually been married knows better than that load of crap.
some of us who got married were simply unable to conceive and bear children.
if i recall, usually focus is on how married people should behave toward each other.
i think the idea is that if married people are behaving toward each other correctly that is the best assurance.
you can be married and want children, or not want children.
she had been married 5 times, left her kids alone while she spent every night with her lovers.
fewer americans are married and fewer have children in the home.
i'm a middle-aged, middle-class, married mother living in a midsize midwestern city.
there is no right to be married, so your statement is moronic.
i guess that's what happens when you are married for 62 years, it's one of my very favorite things.
